answers.author: Murray Levison
answers.text:
Richard,
In the 1980s I worked for the City of Rochester, NY. In the 1970s houses were built so quickly in the suburbs that owners were walking away from their city homes. Over time these vacant homes became a terrible blight. The city used property tax delinquency foreclosures to acquire many properties. Some were sold by auction, some as part of a lottery, and some were demolished to allow for sale lots. Lots were for future owner-occupied homes or were assembled into larger parcels to encourage reuse.
You might try checking with the Center for Governmental Research (cgr.org) to see if they performed any analysis of the demolition and reuse program.
Murray Levison
City of Sacramento, CA

answers.author: Mercy Montgomery
answers.text:
Hi Richard,
Our city has a landbank that has been very active in demolishing blighted properties this year with funding assistance from the Ohio Attorney General's Office's Moving Ohio Forward program. http://www.ohioattorneygeneral.gov/Media/Videos/Moving-Ohio-Forward-Demolition-Program
The Brookings article mentioned earlier has been very helpful for them, as well as this article http://www.communityprogress.net/local-vacant-property-registration-ordinances-in-the-u-s---an-analysis-of-growth--regional-trends--and-some-key-characteristics-resources-156.php (pg. 6 references studies done on the impact of vacant properties).
"The Impact of Vacant, Tax-Delinquent, and Foreclosed Property on Sales Prices of Neighboring Homes"  also may be helpful.(http://papers.ssrn.com/sol3/papers.cfm?abstract_id=1935510)
I hope that these papers are helpful and best of luck with moving forward with the demolition program in Brunswick.  I am a recent "transplant" to Ohio from Athens, GA and have been to Brunswick a few times.
Best,
Mercy Montgomery
City of Hamilton, OH

author: Richard Newbern
text:
Hello! Does anyone have empirical data or studies showing the fiscal or economic impact of house demolitions? I'm sure demolition of dilapidated property has positive long-term fiscal and economic impacts, but I need to prove it. I need property-value data and economic data.
I'm in the coastal City of Brunswick, Georgia and we're tryng to "step-up" our demolition program.
Thank you for any information.
Richard "Dick" Newbern
Brunswick, Ga.
title: Demolition- Fiscal and Economic Impacts
